sentences.sContent: I usually buy all my vegetables at the market.
sentences.sCn: 我通常都是在菜市场里购买蔬菜。

sentences.sContent: Our main overseas market is Japan.
sentences.sCn: 我们的主要海外市场是日本。

sentences.sContent: ...This has wiped 6% off the value of the soft tissue paper market in the UK...
...according to a new report from market research company Mintel...
...the future of the market looks far from rosy...
...He says the market for the tea is unstable and he is often forced to sell his purple tea for the same price as green tea leaves...
...the company commanded90% of the market for photographic film and 85% of the market for cameras...
...we derive massive economic benefits when we buy the most affordable energy on the world market and when we engage in energy trade around the world...
...turning point for a leading American corporation that pioneered consumer photography and dominated the film market for decades...
...the company commanded 90% of the market for photographic film and 85% of the market for cameras...
...And with the low-skilled labor market atomized into thousands of microeconomies...
...says free market economist Veronique de Rugy of the Mercatus Center at George Mason University...

trans.tranOther: a time when people buy and sell goods, food etc, or the place, usually outside or in a large building, where this happens
